column3: Mir Zakah II [1992] - A massive deposit of approximately 500000 gold, silver, and bronze coins spanning early Indian, Greek, Graeco-Bactrian, Indo-Greek, Indo-Scythian, Indo-Parthian, and Kushan periods.
Ai Khanum hoard, A collection of over 1500 Greek and Graeco-Bactrian coins from rulers like Eucratides I, Diodotus I & II, and Euthydemus I & II.
Bajaur hoard [1993] - 800 Indo-Greek drachms featuring coins from Apollodotus I, Antimachus II, and Menander I.
Wesa hoard [1994] - 220 tetradrachms and 1000 drachms from Apollodotus I, Antimachus II, Menander I, Lysias, and Antialcidas.
Mian Khan Sanghou hoard [1993] - 83 silver coins (8 tetradrachms, 75 drachms) from Apollodotus I, Antimachus II, Menander I, and Zoilus I.
Khauzikhelai hoard [1992] - Approximately 800 exclusively Indo-Greek coins from various rulers including Apollodotus I, Antimachus II, and Menander I.
Attock hoard  - 93 tetradrachms and 600 drachms from Menander I, Zoilus I, Lysias, Antialcidas, and Amyntas.
Siranwali hoard I [1990] - 400 coins from Apollodotus I, Antimachus II, Menander I, and Amyntas.
Zentrales Funddepot der Archäologischen Bodenforschung des Kantons Basel-Stadt
